frameDefinitions: A Communicator announces (linguistically or non-linguistically) the  imminent arrival of an Individual or the occurrence of an Event.

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
This frame contains words for types of noise which can be used to characterize verbal communication.

This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.  '' 'The landlord has not yet replied in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.
A person, the Cognizer, thinks about a Topic over a period of time.
frameExamples: The unveiling of Alinghi's keel was <t>heralded</t> by alp horns
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
'Don't treat me as a child!' she <t>cried</t> scornfully.
The landlord has not yet <t>replied</t> in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.DNI
The men were silently <t>mulling</t> <t>over</t> the proposition of committing an assassination
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Communicator</fen> greets the arrival of an <fen>Individual</fen> or occurrence of an <fen>Event</fen>.
The person who is greeted at their arrival by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The occurrence which is greeted by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The symbol-containing artifact whereby a <fen>Communicator</fen> heralds.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Communicator</fen>  heralds.
This role identifies the place where the Communicator heralds.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
<fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
Message has a number of different realizations in this frame, including <ment>that</ment>-clauses, direct quotes, infinitival complements, <ment>for-to</ment> phrases, and NP Objects.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>.
The <fen>Voice</fen> describes the <fex name=''>Speaker'</fex>s utterance or other message-encoded production.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Communication noise event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an event occurs.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun:
This is the person to whom the response is communicated.  When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to':
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:
The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
With a target verb, the Cognizer is usually expressed as an External Argument, with the Topic appearing as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal Complement, or a PP.
With a target verb, the <fen>Topic</fen> is usually expressed as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal complement, or a PP.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers the <fen>Topic</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Sheep scattered from the road as trumpets heralded <fex>his arrival at the castle gates</fex>
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
<fex>'What are you doing?'</fex> Kim inquired.
Pat inquired <fex>about train times</fex>.
I inquired <fex>yesterday</fex>.
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
<fex>Kim</fex> whined that it wasn't fair.
Kim whined <fex>that it wasn't fair</fex>.
Kim howled <fex>about the unfairness of it all</fex>.
<fex>John's voice</fex> bellowed for her to be quiet.
<fex>Sue</fex> responded to the objection convincingly.
Sue answered <fex>Bob</fex> immediately.
<fex>'I can't help you,'</fex> Sue answered.
My boss still hasn't given me an answer <fex>about a promotion</fex>.
Sue answered <fex>the question</fex>.
A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not replied <fex>after 28 days</fex>.
This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa responded <fex>in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.
<fex>Pat</fex> considered a career change.
Pat considered <fex>a career change</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: "Manuale Astronomicon libri quinque et Arati Phænomena
Cométographie ou Traité historique et théorique des comètes"
Projet d'une histoire d'astronomie du dix-septième siècle"
Vol. 12. New York: Robert Appleton Company
"Mémoires sur l'histoire de France de Michaud et Poujoulat"
